abstract: The F.D.A. rejected Arcoxia because of concerns that the drug could cause as many as 30,000 heart attacks a year if widely used.
snippet: The F.D.A. rejected Arcoxia because of concerns that the drug could cause as many as 30,000 heart attacks a year if widely used.
lead_paragraph: GAITHERSBURG, Md., April 12 — A panel of federal drug advisers voted 20-to-1 today to reject an application by Merck to sell its pain pill Arcoxia because of concerns that the drug could cause as many as 30,000 heart attacks a year if widely used.

headline.main: F.D.A. Panel Rejects Merck Pain Pill in 20-1 Vote
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Panel Rejects Merck Pain Pill in 20-1 Vote
